maml:description.maml:para: Adds computer names to the tab expansion database.
This command is used to add computer names to the tab expansion database. The computer names can then be used to tab expand contexts that use computer names, for example the -ComputerName parameter.
Changes to the database need to be saved using Export-TabExpansionDatabase.
A computer name to add to the database.
Causes this command to gather computer names using "net view".
Specifies an Organizational Unit (OU) from Active Directory containing computers that should be added to the tab expansion database.
You can pipe a DirectoryEntry to Add-TabExpansionComputer to store all computer names that are a part of an OU in the tab expansion database.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description
In this example a list of computer names is stored in the "servers.txt" file. Then the file is read and the names added to the tab expansion database by piping into this command.
Description
This example will use "net view" to add a list of computer names to the tab expansion database. This is the same command used by Update-TabExpansionDatabase
NOTE: It is strongly suggest to run Remove-TabExpansionComputer before this command to prevent duplicate entries in the tab expansion database.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds an item to the tab expansion database.
This command is used to add items to the tab expansion database.
Items for COM objects, .NET types, or WMI objects can not be added using this command. Please use the specific commands for those items.
Changes to the database need to be saved using Export-TabExpansionDatabase.
The text to match against user input.
The output text to present to the user. This value is often the same as Filter.
The specific feature of PowerTab that the item is to be associated with.

-- Alias: The item defines an alias that does not exist for a PowerShell command or application. -- Custom: An item for the custom expansion character(^). -- Computer: The item represents a computer name. -- Invoke: An item for the invoke character (&).
Items for COM objects, .NET types, or WMI objects can not be added using this command.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Add-TabExpansion -Filter "test" -Text "Your first custom tab expansion was a success!" -Type Custom

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description
This example will add a custom pattern that will turn "test^" into the above sentence after pressing the tab key.
Changes to the database need to be saved using Export-TabExpansionDatabase.

maml:description.maml:para: Add type names from an Assembly to the tab expansion database.
This command will add a list of .NET type names that are part of an Assembly to the tab expansion database.
Changes to the database need to be saved using Export-TabExpansionDatabase.
The Assembly object represent a .NET assembly with types to be added to the tab expansion database.
You can pipe an Assembly to Add-TabExpansionType to store all type names from the assembly in the tab expansion database.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description

This example will first load the assembly "myassembly." Then the assembly object is gathered by combining the "-PassThru" parameter of Add-Type with "Select-Object -ExpandProperty" to pipe into Add-TabExpansionType to add the contained types to the tab expansion database.

maml:description.maml:para: Saves the current PowerTab configuration to a file.
This command will export the PowerTab configuration settings to a file. Configuration changes are not automatically saved and must be manually exported.
By default this command will export to the path specified in $PowerTabConfig.Setup.ConfigurationPath.
The path to the file to store the PowerTab configuration in.
The special value "IsolatedStorage" can be specified and PowerTab will safely choose a file unique to the current user.
You can pipe a string that contains a path to Export-TabExpansionConfig.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description
This example will save the PowerTab configuration to an XML file in the home directory of the current user.

maml:description.maml:para: Saves the tab expansion database to a file.
This command will export the tab expansion database to a file. Updates to the tab expansion database are not automatically saved and must be manually exported.
By default this command will export to the path specified in $PowerTabConfig.Setup.DatabasePath.
The path to the file to store the tab expansion database in.
The special value "IsolatedStorage" can be specified and PowerTab will safely choose a file unique to the current user.
You can pipe a string that contains a path to Export-TabExpansionDatabase.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description
This example will save the tab expansion database to an XML file in the home directory of the current user.

maml:description.maml:para: Saves the current PowerTab color theme to a file.
This command can be used to save the current color settings as a named theme for PowerTab, or to a separate file. Current color settings are stored in the PowerTab configuration settings.
The path to the file to store the color settings in.
Specifies the name of the theme to save the current color settings to. Themes can be imported by name.
You can pipe a string that contains a path to Export-TabExpansionTheme.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description
This example will create a new named color theme. Themes are stored in files within the install location of PowerTab.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets items available in the tab expansion database.
This command retrieves items from the currently loaded tab expansion database.
A pattern to match the filter property of items in the tab expansion database.
The collection or collections of items to search.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description
This example will return all .NET types under the System namespace from the tab expansion database.

maml:description.maml:para: Loads the PowerTab configuration from a file.
This command will import the PowerTab configuration settings from a file. The current onfiguration will be replaced by the contents of the config file.
By default this command will import from the path specified in $PowerTabConfig.Setup.ConfigurationPath.
The path to the file to load the PowerTab configuration from.
The special value "IsolatedStorage" can be specified and PowerTab will safely choose a file unique to the current user.
You can pipe a string that contains a path to Import-TabExpansionConfig.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description
This example will reset the current configuration to the last saved set of settings from the PowerTab config file.

maml:description.maml:para: Loads the tab expansion database from a file.
This command will import the tab expansion database from a file. The current tab expansion database will be replaced by the contents of the specified file.
By default this command will import from the path specified in $PowerTabConfig.Setup.DatabasePath.
The path to the file to load the tab expansion database from.
The special value "IsolatedStorage" can be specified and PowerTab will safely choose a file unique to the current user.
You can pipe a string that contains a path to Import-TabExpansionDatabase.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description
This example will load the tab expansion database from a file safely stored in Isolated Storage.

maml:description.maml:para: Loads a PowerTab color theme from a file.
This command will import color settings from a named theme or from a file.
The path to the file to load the color settings from.
Specifies the name of the theme to import color settings from.
You can pipe a string that contains a path to Import-TabExpansionTheme.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description
This example will load the color theme named "Digital." Tab expansion of theme names is supported.

maml:description.maml:para: Opens a user interface for editing the tab expansion database.
This command will open a simple interface for editing the tab expansion database.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description
Opens an editor for the tab expansion database.

maml:description.maml:para: Replaces the PowerTab configuration with default values.
This command will reset the configuration settings of PowerTab to their default values.
Specifies the value for ConfigurationPath, but a file is not created.
You can pipe a FileInfo object (or any object with a path) to New-TabExpansionConfig.
You can pipe a string that contains a path to New-TabExpansionConfig.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description
This example will reset the PowerTab configuration to defaults.

maml:description.maml:para: Replaces the tab expansion database with a new clear database.
This command clean the tab expansion database and refil it with a few default values.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description
This example will clean the tab expansion database.

maml:description.maml:para: Registers a handler to take part in tab expansion of parameters and parameter values.
This command allows for the creation of handlers that extend PowerTab to support unique command or parameter usage.
Register the new handler even if a similar handler already exists.
A ScriptBlock defining the body of the handler.
The name of the command or parameter that the handler will target.
The type of handler to register. Valid values for Type are:

-- Command: Handler will have first chance at any expansion involving the registered command. -- Parameter: Handler will respond to all uses of a parameter not already handled by a Command handler. -- ParameterName: Special use handler to provide parameter names for non-PowerShell commands. -- CommandInfo: Special use handler to tell PowerTab about positional parameters and enumeration values.
You can pipe a hashtable that contains keys named "Name" or "Handler to Register-TabExpansion.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description
This example is simplified from the Get-Service handler in PowerTab. Please read about_PowerTab_handlers for a more indepth explanation.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes all stored computer names from the tab expansion database.
This command will remove all computer name entries from the tab expansion database.
Changes to the database need to be saved using Export-TabExpansionDatabase.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description
This example will remove all computer name entries from the tab expansion database.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes items from the tab expansion database.
This command can remove items from the tab expansion database.
Changes to the database need to be saved using Export-TabExpansionDatabase.
A pattern to match the Filter property of items from the tab expansion database to be removed.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description
This example will remove some of the custom filters that turn "h^" into calls to Get-Help
Changes to the database need to be saved using Export-TabExpansionDatabase.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates the tab expansion database with fresh lists of items.
This command will update all parts of the tab expansion database. The database stores source information that takes a long time to gather, such as a list of computer names on the network.
Changes to the database need to be saved using Export-TabExpansionDatabase.
Forces an update of the tab expansion database.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description
This example will update the tab expansion database, but prompt for each step of the update.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates the tab expansion database with a fresh list of .NET type names.
This command will update the list of .NET types in the tab expansion database.
Changes to the database need to be saved using Export-TabExpansionDatabase.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description
Updates the list of .NET types.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates the tab expansion database with a fresh list of COM ProgIDs.
This command will update the list of ProgIDs for COM objects in the tab expansion database.
Changes to the database need to be saved using Export-TabExpansionDatabase.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description
Updates the list of ProgIDs for COM objects.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates the tab expansion database with a fresh list of WMI class names.
This command will update the list of WMI classes in the tab expansion database.
Changes to the database need to be saved using Export-TabExpansionDatabase.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description
Updates the list of WMI classes.
